intro: Melochia vestita, commonly known as the velvetleaf or silky mallow, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its fibrous roots and robust growth make it adaptable to various soil types, though it prefers moist, well-drained conditions. Melochia vestita is often found in disturbed areas and can become invasive in certain regions.
